004
005package edu.wpi.first.math.geometry;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.math.MatBuilder;
008import edu.wpi.first.math.Matrix;
009import edu.wpi.first.math.Nat;
010import edu.wpi.first.math.VecBuilder;
011import edu.wpi.first.math.Vector;
012import edu.wpi.first.math.interpolation.Interpolatable;
013import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N3;
014import java.util.Objects;
015
016/** Represents a 3D pose containing translational and rotational elements. */
017public class Pose3d implements Interpolatable<Pose3d> {
018  private final Translation3d m_translation;
019  private final Rotation3d m_rotation;
020
021  /** Constructs a pose at the origin facing toward the positive X axis. */
022  public Pose3d() {
023    m_translation = new Translation3d();
024    m_rotation = new Rotation3d();
025  }
026
027  /**
028   * Constructs a pose with the specified translation and rotation.
029   *
030   * @param translation The translational component of the pose.
031   * @param rotation The rotational component of the pose.
032   */
033  public Pose3d(Translation3d translation, Rotation3d rotation) {
034    m_translation = translation;
035    m_rotation = rotation;
036  }
037
038  /**
039   * Constructs a pose with x, y, and z translations instead of a separate Translation3d.
040   *
041   * @param x The x component of the translational component of the pose.
042   * @param y The y component of the translational component of the pose.
043   * @param z The z component of the translational component of the pose.
044   * @param rotation The rotational component of the pose.
045   */
046  public Pose3d(double x, double y, double z, Rotation3d rotation) {
047    m_translation = new Translation3d(x, y, z);
048    m_rotation = rotation;
049  }
050
051  /**
052   * Transforms the pose by the given transformation and returns the new transformed pose.
053   *
054   * @param other The transform to transform the pose by.
055   * @return The transformed pose.
056   */
057  public Pose3d plus(Transform3d other) {
058    return transformBy(other);
059  }
060
061  /**
062   * Returns the Transform3d that maps the one pose to another.
063   *
064   * @param other The initial pose of the transformation.
065   * @return The transform that maps the other pose to the current pose.
066   */
067  public Transform3d minus(Pose3d other) {
068    final var pose = this.relativeTo(other);
069    return new Transform3d(pose.getTranslation(), pose.getRotation());
070  }
071
072  /**
073   * Returns the translation component of the transformation.
074   *
075   * @return The translational component of the pose.
076   */
077  public Translation3d getTranslation() {
078    return m_translation;
079  }
080
081  /**
082   * Returns the X component of the pose's translation.
083   *
084   * @return The x component of the pose's translation.
085   */
086  public double getX() {
087    return m_translation.getX();
088  }
089
090  /**
091   * Returns the Y component of the pose's translation.
092   *
093   * @return The y component of the pose's translation.
094   */
095  public double getY() {
096    return m_translation.getY();
097  }
098
099  /**
100   * Returns the Z component of the pose's translation.
101   *
102   * @return The z component of the pose's translation.
103   */
104  public double getZ() {
105    return m_translation.getZ();
106  }
107
108  /**
109   * Returns the rotational component of the transformation.
110   *
111   * @return The rotational component of the pose.
112   */
113  public Rotation3d getRotation() {
114    return m_rotation;
115  }
116
117  /**
118   * Transforms the pose by the given transformation and returns the new pose. See + operator for
119   * the matrix multiplication performed.
120   *
121   * @param other The transform to transform the pose by.
122   * @return The transformed pose.
123   */
124  public Pose3d transformBy(Transform3d other) {
125    return new Pose3d(
126        m_translation.plus(other.getTranslation().rotateBy(m_rotation)),
127        m_rotation.plus(other.getRotation()));
128  }
129
130  /**
131   * Returns the other pose relative to the current pose.
132   *
133   * <p>This function can often be used for trajectory tracking or pose stabilization algorithms to
134   * get the error between the reference and the current pose.
135   *
136   * @param other The pose that is the origin of the new coordinate frame that the current pose will
137   *     be converted into.
138   * @return The current pose relative to the new origin pose.
139   */
140  public Pose3d relativeTo(Pose3d other) {
141    var transform = new Transform3d(other, this);
142    return new Pose3d(transform.getTranslation(), transform.getRotation());
143  }
144
145  /**
146   * Obtain a new Pose3d from a (constant curvature) velocity.
147   *
148   * <p>The twist is a change in pose in the robot's coordinate frame since the previous pose
149   * update. When the user runs exp() on the previous known field-relative pose with the argument
150   * being the twist, the user will receive the new field-relative pose.
151   *
152   * <p>"Exp" represents the pose exponential, which is solving a differential equation moving the
153   * pose forward in time.
154   *
155   * @param twist The change in pose in the robot's coordinate frame since the previous pose update.
156   *     For example, if a non-holonomic robot moves forward 0.01 meters and changes angle by 0.5
157   *     degrees since the previous pose update, the twist would be Twist3d(0.01, 0.0, 0.0, new new
158   *     Rotation3d(0.0, 0.0, Units.degreesToRadians(0.5))).
159   * @return The new pose of the robot.
160   */
161  public Pose3d exp(Twist3d twist) {
162    final var Omega = rotationVectorToMatrix(VecBuilder.fill(twist.rx, twist.ry, twist.rz));
163    final var OmegaSq = Omega.times(Omega);
164
165    double thetaSq = twist.rx * twist.rx + twist.ry * twist.ry + twist.rz * twist.rz;
166
167    // Get left Jacobian of SO3. See first line in right column of
168    // http://asrl.utias.utoronto.ca/~tdb/bib/barfoot_ser17_identities.pdf
169    Matrix<N3, N3> J;
170    if (thetaSq < 1E-9 * 1E-9) {
171      // J = I + 0.5ω
172      J = Matrix.eye(Nat.N3()).plus(Omega.times(0.5));
173    } else {
174      double theta = Math.sqrt(thetaSq);
175      // J = I + (1 − cos(θ))/θ² ω + (θ − sin(θ))/θ³ ω²
176      J =
177          Matrix.eye(Nat.N3())
178              .plus(Omega.times((1.0 - Math.cos(theta)) / thetaSq))
179              .plus(OmegaSq.times((theta - Math.sin(theta)) / (thetaSq * theta)));
180    }
181
182    // Get translation component
183    final var translation =
184        J.times(new MatBuilder<>(Nat.N3(), Nat.N1()).fill(twist.dx, twist.dy, twist.dz));
185
186    final var transform =
187        new Transform3d(
188            new Translation3d(translation.get(0, 0), translation.get(1, 0), translation.get(2, 0)),
189            new Rotation3d(twist.rx, twist.ry, twist.rz));
190
191    return this.plus(transform);
192  }
193
194  /**
195   * Returns a Twist3d that maps this pose to the end pose. If c is the output of a.Log(b), then
196   * a.Exp(c) would yield b.
197   *
198   * @param end The end pose for the transformation.
199   * @return The twist that maps this to end.
200   */
201  public Twist3d log(Pose3d end) {
202    final var transform = end.relativeTo(this);
203
204    final var rotVec = transform.getRotation().getQuaternion().toRotationVector();
205
206    final var Omega = rotationVectorToMatrix(rotVec);
207    final var OmegaSq = Omega.times(Omega);
208
209    double thetaSq =
210        rotVec.get(0, 0) * rotVec.get(0, 0)
211            + rotVec.get(1, 0) * rotVec.get(1, 0)
212            + rotVec.get(2, 0) * rotVec.get(2, 0);
213
214    // Get left Jacobian inverse of SO3. See fourth line in right column of
215    // http://asrl.utias.utoronto.ca/~tdb/bib/barfoot_ser17_identities.pdf
216    Matrix<N3, N3> Jinv;
217    if (thetaSq < 1E-9 * 1E-9) {
218      // J⁻¹ = I − 0.5ω + 1/12 ω²
219      Jinv = Matrix.eye(Nat.N3()).minus(Omega.times(0.5)).plus(OmegaSq.times(1.0 / 12.0));
220    } else {
221      double theta = Math.sqrt(thetaSq);
222      double halfTheta = 0.5 * theta;
223
224      // J⁻¹ = I − 0.5ω + (1 − 0.5θ cos(θ/2) / sin(θ/2))/θ² ω²
225      Jinv =
226          Matrix.eye(Nat.N3())
227              .minus(Omega.times(0.5))
228              .plus(
229                  OmegaSq.times(
230                      (1.0 - 0.5 * theta * Math.cos(halfTheta) / Math.sin(halfTheta)) / thetaSq));
231    }
232
233    // Get dtranslation component
234    final var dtranslation =
235        Jinv.times(
236            new MatBuilder<>(Nat.N3(), Nat.N1())
237                .fill(transform.getX(), transform.getY(), transform.getZ()));
238
239    return new Twist3d(
240        dtranslation.get(0, 0),
241        dtranslation.get(1, 0),
242        dtranslation.get(2, 0),
243        rotVec.get(0, 0),
244        rotVec.get(1, 0),
245        rotVec.get(2, 0));
246  }
247
248  /**
249   * Returns a Pose2d representing this Pose3d projected into the X-Y plane.
250   *
251   * @return A Pose2d representing this Pose3d projected into the X-Y plane.
252   */
253  public Pose2d toPose2d() {
254    return new Pose2d(m_translation.toTranslation2d(), m_rotation.toRotation2d());
255  }
256
257  @Override
258  public String toString() {
259    return String.format("Pose3d(%s, %s)", m_translation, m_rotation);
260  }
261
262  /**
263   * Checks equality between this Pose3d and another object.
264   *
265   * @param obj The other object.
266   * @return Whether the two objects are equal or not.
267   */
268  @Override
269  public boolean equals(Object obj) {
270    if (obj instanceof Pose3d) {
271      return ((Pose3d) obj).m_translation.equals(m_translation)
272          && ((Pose3d) obj).m_rotation.equals(m_rotation);
273    }
274    return false;
275  }
276
277  @Override
278  public int hashCode() {
279    return Objects.hash(m_translation, m_rotation);
280  }
281
282  @Override
283  public Pose3d interpolate(Pose3d endValue, double t) {
284    if (t < 0) {
285      return this;
286    } else if (t >= 1) {
287      return endValue;
288    } else {
289      var twist = this.log(endValue);
290      var scaledTwist =
291          new Twist3d(
292              twist.dx * t, twist.dy * t, twist.dz * t, twist.rx * t, twist.ry * t, twist.rz * t);
293      return this.exp(scaledTwist);
294    }
295  }
296
297  /**
298   * Applies the hat operator to a rotation vector.
299   *
300   * <p>It takes a rotation vector and returns the corresponding matrix representation of the Lie
301   * algebra element (a 3x3 rotation matrix).
302   *
303   * @param rotation The rotation vector.
304   * @return The rotation vector as a 3x3 rotation matrix.
305   */
306  private Matrix<N3, N3> rotationVectorToMatrix(Vector<N3> rotation) {
307    // Given a rotation vector <a, b, c>,
308    //         [ 0 -c  b]
309    // Omega = [ c  0 -a]
310    //         [-b  a  0]
311    return new MatBuilder<>(Nat.N3(), Nat.N3())
312        .fill(
313            0.0,
314            -rotation.get(2, 0),
315            rotation.get(1, 0),
316            rotation.get(2, 0),
317            0.0,
318            -rotation.get(0, 0),
319            -rotation.get(1, 0),
320            rotation.get(0, 0),
321            0.0);
322  }
323}
